byline.contributor: Mia Li, Sarah Li and Jonah Kessel contributed research.

abstract: Restrictions imposed by Chinese education officials on teaching languages of country's ethnic minorities fuels anxiety and resentment among Tibetans, who fear for survival of their culture; students protest imposition of Chinese as primary language, sometimes resorting to self-immolation, while their parents tout practical benefits of assimilation.
lead_paragraph: New measures scaling back the teaching of minority languages like Tibetan have threatened the survival of ethnic identities and traditions in China’s vast west.

headline.main: Tibetans Fight to Salvage Fading Culture in China
headline.print_headline: Tibetans Struggle to Salvage Fading Culture

snippet: New measures scaling back the teaching of minority languages like Tibetan have threatened the survival of ethnic identities and traditions in China’s vast west.
